problem_text:
Suppose we have [a, b] = [c, d] in an absolutely free group, where a, b, [a, b] are basic commutators (in some fixed free generators). If c and d are arbitrary (proper) commutators, does it follow that a = c and b = d?
A. Gaglione, D. Spellman
answer:
No, not always.
For example, if x1, x2, x3 are free generators,
x1 < x2 < x3,
a = [[x2, x1], x3], b = [x2, x1], c = b−1, d = bx3b (V. G. Bardakov, Abstracts of the IIIrd Intern. Conf. on Algebra, Krasnoyarsk, 1993, p. 33 (Russian)).
